extracted-table.table-caption: Resting-state functional connectivity found correlated positively with the temporal order threshold (TOT) values in all participants (n = 65) after controlling for gender.

caption.p: Resting-state functional connectivity found correlated positively with the temporal order threshold (TOT) values in all participants (n = 65) after controlling for gender.

tr.th: Main region in the target area
p-value FDRCp < 0.05 corrand Bonferroni p < 0.05 corr

table-wrap-foot.p: The Montreal Neurological Institute (MNI) coordinates for the center position of the seed are placed in the bracket, right after the seeds’s name, whereas the MNI coordinates of the peak voxel of each target region are in a separate column. The relationships were significant (mass p-value FDRC, p < 0.05) with Bonferroni correction for multiple comparisons (p < 0.05).

extracted-table.table-caption: The list of the sources included in the resting-state functional connectivity analysis.

caption.p: The list of the sources included in the resting-state functional connectivity analysis.

table-wrap-foot.p: The Montreal Neurological Institute (MNI) coordinates of the central positions of the seeds were taken from the work by Davis et al.27, who found nine regions belonging to either the left or right temporal parietal junction, activated by the fMRI visual temporal order judgment tasks.
